trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox"></xref> adapter class for the WML device adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlTextBoxAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.

Returns the postback value (or empty string) of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox"></xref> when the parent form's action attribute is set and view state is disabled for the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The postback value (or empty string) of the selected item in the selection list.
Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Generates the target-specific markup for the control to which the control adapter is attached, using the provided writer.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer to receive output.
